segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) is a version of Windows 10 that is optimized for smaller devices with or without a display.

segment.source: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.
segment.target: IoT Core uses the rich, extensible Universal Windows Platform (UWP) API for building great solutions.

segment.source: What's new in IoT Core manufacturing
segment.target: What's new in IoT Core manufacturing

segment.source: What's new in IoT Core manufacturing
segment.target: What's new in IoT Core manufacturing

segment.source: IoT Core Add-Ons
segment.target: IoT Core Add-Ons

segment.source: New BSP tools added:
segment.target: New BSP tools added:

segment.source: New folder structure: BSPs are now stored in separate folders, \iot-adk-addonkit\Source-\BSP.
segment.target: New folder structure: BSPs are now stored in separate folders, \iot-adk-addonkit\Source-\BSP.

segment.source: Multiple projects can now more easily share the same BSP folder.
segment.target: Multiple projects can now more easily share the same BSP folder.

segment.source: Updated tool: newproduct: Now allows you to link to a custom BSP.
segment.target: Updated tool: newproduct: Now allows you to link to a custom BSP.

segment.source: By default, arm builds default to RPi2, x86 builds default to MBM.
segment.target: By default, arm builds default to RPi2, x86 builds default to MBM.

segment.source: Updated lab: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package
segment.target: Updated lab: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package

segment.source: June 9, 2016: Several updates of command-line tools:
segment.target: June 9, 2016: Several updates of command-line tools:

segment.source: New tool: BuildImage.cmd.
segment.target: New tool: BuildImage.cmd.

segment.source: Similar to CreateImage.cmd, this tool can build multiple images at a time, which can be useful for automated testing.
segment.target: Similar to CreateImage.cmd, this tool can build multiple images at a time, which can be useful for automated testing.

segment.source: To troubleshoot, see log files at \Buildarch>\pkgs\logs.
segment.target: To troubleshoot, see log files at \Buildarch>\pkgs\logs.

segment.source: Updated: Update apps on your IoT Core devices.
segment.target: Updated: Update apps on your IoT Core devices.

segment.source: You can use the same procedures to build app packages and app update packages.
segment.target: You can use the same procedures to build app packages and app update packages.

segment.source: For Windows 10, version 1607, you can also update your apps through the Windows Store.
segment.target: For Windows 10, version 1607, you can also update your apps through the Windows Store.

segment.source: May 18, 2016: Several updates of command-line tools:
segment.target: May 18, 2016: Several updates of command-line tools:

segment.source: Added new tools:
segment.target: Added new tools:

segment.source: NewAppxPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for creating app packages based on .appx files, certificates, and dependencies.
segment.target: NewAppxPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for creating app packages based on .appx files, certificates, and dependencies.

segment.source: NewDrvPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for creating driver packages based on .inf files.
segment.target: NewDrvPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for creating driver packages based on .inf files.

segment.source: NewCommonPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for files, folders, registry keys, and other items that aren't architecture-specific.
segment.target: NewCommonPkg: Creates and prepares working folders for files, folders, registry keys, and other items that aren't architecture-specific.

segment.source: Inf2Cab: Converts a .inf file to a .cab file.
segment.target: Inf2Cab: Converts a .inf file to a .cab file.

segment.source: BuildPkg: Builds .cab packages using working folders.
segment.target: BuildPkg: Builds .cab packages using working folders.

segment.source: Deprecated tools:
segment.target: Deprecated tools:

segment.source: BuildAllPackages.
segment.target: BuildAllPackages.

segment.source: Use BuildPkg instead.
segment.target: Use BuildPkg instead.

segment.source: NewPkg.
segment.target: NewPkg.

segment.source: Use newappxpkg, newdrvpkg, and newcommonpkg instead.
segment.target: Use newappxpkg, newdrvpkg, and newcommonpkg instead.

segment.source: Troubleshooting and logging: When building packages, you'll get a cleaner display just showing the packages that have been processed, and any errors.
segment.target: Troubleshooting and logging: When building packages, you'll get a cleaner display just showing the packages that have been processed, and any errors.

segment.source: To troubleshoot, you can now see the full log files at \Buildarch>\pkgs\logs.
segment.target: To troubleshoot, you can now see the full log files at \Buildarch>\pkgs\logs.

segment.source: Updated: CreatePkg now supports adding just the Component.Subcomponent names.
segment.target: Updated: CreatePkg now supports adding just the Component.Subcomponent names.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Manufacturing labs: Updated labs to use new NewAppPkg, NewDriverPkg, NewCommonPkg tools.
segment.target: Manufacturing labs: Updated labs to use new NewAppPkg, NewDriverPkg, NewCommonPkg tools.
